stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.

stadium.name: The High-Pass Pitch
stadium.description: A field built at a breathtaking altitude in a fortified mountain pass. The air is painfully thin, and the weather is dangerously unpredictable.

stats.pregame_ritual: Tying a small, hand-carved wooden bird to their gear.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Avoiding eye contact with anyone wearing the color green.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Whispering a secret fear to the Trollball before the game.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Dipping their hands in a bucket of ice-cold well water.
Asking a teammate to tell them a story, but only the beginning.
Exchanging well-wishes with their direct opponent before the game starts.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.

Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.

preGame:
Step right up, sports fans, for the final salt-crusted showdown of the regular season! We are perched precariously atop The Cliffside Pitch in Southport, where the gale-force winds are currently trying to remodel my face and the sea spray is keeping the grog conveniently diluted! It is a beautiful day for a bloodbath as The Southport Narwhals prepare to defend their turf against the high-altitude hitters, The Oread's Summit Tamers! I can see the fans clinging to the rocky outcroppings for dear life, and boy howdy, the energy is more volatile than a bag of disgruntled imps! 

Speaking of volatile, have you seen the pre-game rituals today? Malcolm Goer of the Narwhals is currently rubbing the Trollball in their armpits for that signature 'grip'‚ÄîI can smell the commitment from the booth! Meanwhile, over in the Tamers' camp, Odericus Juxon is slapping her own helmet with such vigor I‚Äôm surprised she hasn‚Äôt knocked herself out before the whistle! Alwyn Wandy is whispering sweet terrors to the troll head, probably telling it about the time Sir Tanos tried to use a map and got lost in a closet. 

The best part of tonight‚Äôs festivities? The bar is wide open and the taps are flowing faster than the blood in a slaughterhouse! We‚Äôve got players hydrating with the hard stuff, and I expect the carnage to be appropriately blurry. King Nezmear might be proud of his northern werewolf breeders, but even those mangy mutts couldn't handle the Southport moonshine! Don't expect any of those 'heroes' like the Moonslayer Artorias to show up; they‚Äôre likely too busy admiring their own reflections to enjoy a good cliffside tumble. Let's get to the action! üåäüçªüèà
postGame:
Holy smoke, what a marvelous, fermented massacre! The Oread's Summit Tamers didn't just win; they absolutely dismantled the Southport Narwhals with a staggering 5 to 0 shutout! It was a mountain-sized beatdown that left the home crowd flatter than a pancake in a gravity well. The Tamers came for the booze and stayed for the bruises, proving that altitude and alcohol are a winning combination! üèîÔ∏èüß§

The mayhem kicked off early when Edme Virgil scooped up that leathery troll head in Center Field like it was a prize ham! It didn't take long for Clippard Burr to decide that running was for suckers, launching a magnificent shot from mid-field that snapped through the goal like a whip! Before the Narwhals could even wipe the sea spray from their eyes, Burr did it again‚Äîanother two points on the board! üéØüç∫

But wait, the brutality was just getting started! Dric Trilley showed off some fancy footwork, dancing through the gale-force winds to deliver a thunderous dunk right into the end zone! The Open Bar was clearly kicking in, as the players started hitting harder than a falling anvil. Edme Virgil‚Äîbless that wicked soul‚Äîabsolutely leveled Cibis Areta, sending the Narwhal spiraling toward the healer's bench. It was a hit so crisp it would make my boss, Lord Orzalon, weep with joy! üí•üëä

As the second half rolled around, the 'tipsy' stage of the game transitioned into full-blown 'stumbling' territory! We saw Malcolm Goer and Alwyn Wandy weaving across the pitch like they were trying to walk on a deck in a hurricane. Poor Fineman Dolhenty spent so much time being revived by Sand Denys the Healer that I‚Äôm surprised she didn't just set up a permanent tent on the sidelines! Zadoc Wyatan was particularly unkind to her, handing out injuries like they were flyers for a circus! ü•¥ü©π

Saloma Talich decided to put the final nails in the Narwhals' coffin, firing off two spectacular shots from Center Field while everyone else was busy seeing double! Even with the wind howling and the sea spray blinding them, Talich‚Äôs aim was true‚Äîor maybe the goal just looked twice as big to him! The Narwhals tried to answer back, but their attempts at offense were more comical than a fey circus. üé™üéØ

I have to mention the 'drunken' highlights‚Äîor lowlights, depending on how much you like accuracy! Alwyn Wandy attempted a shot so wildly off-target it nearly hit a seagull in the next county, and Blood Eppes followed suit with a drunken heave that went nowhere fast! It‚Äôs hard to score when the ball looks like a swarm of bees and the ground is moving more than the players! ü•¥üê¶

The defense for the Tamers was like a mountain wall‚Äîmostly because they were leaning on each other to stay upright! They kept the Narwhals completely off the board, leaving Loralyn Lyndy holding the ball at the final whistle like a child who lost their lunch money. It was a complete and total whitewash on the Southport coast! üõ°Ô∏èüö´

I must say, even though my heart beats for the Ebon Gate Corruptors, you have to admire the sheer grit of these Tamers. They drank the bar dry and left the Narwhals soaking wet and salty! I bet King Nezmear is up in his tower, crying into his mead while Elizabeef the werecow looks on in sheer disappointment. This wasn't a game; it was a tavern clearing with a scorekeeper! üêÑüíß

As we look toward the playoffs, the Tamers are riding high on a wave of momentum and moonshine! Southport, on the other hand, is heading home with nothing but massive hangovers and a collection of new scars to show off at the lighthouse. No one can say Trollball isn't the greatest sport in Osterra after a display of violence and intoxication like that! üèÜüçæ

Final Score: Oread's Summit Tamers 5, Southport Narwhals 0. The winds were high, the spirits were higher, and the Narwhals were lower than a snake's belly in a rut! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful, bloody, and boozy Tuesday night in history! Stay wicked, Osterra, and keep those healers busy! üòàüéôÔ∏è
